head.title: Routines for Comparing CppAD with FADBAD

meta.name: description
meta.content: Routines for Comparing CppAD with FADBAD

html.body:
previous next contents reference index search external This: section, frame Routines for Comparing CppAD with FADBAD
Description
These examples and speed tests are used to compare FADBAD
with CppAD. They are located in the directory CppAD/FADBAD. Note that they can only be run under Unix (or Cygwin on Microsoft windows).
FADBAD Install Directory
The following text appears in the file CppAD/FADBAD/Makefile.
FADBAD = d:/FADBAD++
Before you compile and run these tests you will have to replace the text d:/FADBAD++ with directory where FADBAD++ is installed on your machine.
Example
In a unix operating system (or in a Cygwin shell on an Microsoft system), you can compile link and run this list examples and results comparison between FADBAD and CppAD using the following commands:
cd CppAD/FADBAD
make Example
Example
Speed
In a unix operating system (or in a Cygwin shell on an Microsoft system), you can compile link and run the list of speed comparisons between CppAD and FADBAD using the following commands:
cd CppAD/FADBAD
make Speed
Speed
Contents
Run All The FADBAD Speed Comparison Tests
Compare FADBAD and CppAD Results
FADBAD & CppAD Gradient of Determinant by Minors
FADBAD & CppAD Gradient of Determinant by Lu Factorization
Input File: omh\FADBAD.omh
